FuncDef: The display sr-te policy status command displays SR-MPLS TE Policy status.
CLIs: display sr-te policy status { endpoint <ipv4-address> color <color-value> | policy-name <name-value> | binding-sid <binding-sid> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the endpoint of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the color value of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies a binding SID.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 1048575.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display sr-te policy status policy-name p7
Check Policy Not Reach Limit            : Pass
Check Segment List Not Reach Limit      : --
Exist Valid BSID for Stitching            : Yes
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check SR-MPLS TE Policy status for determining the reason why an SR-MPLS TE Policy cannot go up, run the display sr-te policy status command. The command output facilitates troubleshooting.
